item.description:
Over the winter, I offered this as a hike but we went off onto the Tunix Trail to make it challenging. This will be a walk on the groomed nature trail through the preserve. There are areas that have an incline but in general this is a nice 3 mile loop. Maybe you will see the beavers out of their lodge.

Sessions Woods Walk, Burlington

When: Saturday Apr 18, 1:30 PM

Come take a stroll around a Wildlife Management Area. There is a beaver pond, lookout tower, water fall, and summer house to see.

This will be an easy walk of about 3 miles on moderate ups and downs. One long down hill and up hill. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 to 3 hours. Rain cancels.

Dogs are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved. You know best how your dog will react. We could have a small or large crowd, and there may be other dogs.

Location: 341 Milford St, Route 69, Burlington. Park in the lot to the left as you enter the driveway. We will gather near the gazebo.
http://www.mapquest.c...

Walk is being lead by Larry. Contact him through his profile: http://www.meetup.com...
item.how_to_find_us: Larry will be leading this event.
